wmisc 0.2.18.9000

    Creates a t.test table for multiple dependent variables

    t_test_table.Rd

    Creates a t.test table for multiple dependent variables

    t_test_table(
  dv,
  iv,
  data,
  method = "cohen",
  conditions = levels(factor(iv))[order],
  labels = NULL,
  concise = TRUE,
  nice_p = TRUE,
  digits = 1,
  var_equal = FALSE,
  label_attr = TRUE,
  manova = TRUE,
  order = 1:2,
  type = "html",
  caption = "t-test table",
  bootstrap_options = c("condensed", "striped", "hover"),
  full_width = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    dv

    A data frame with the dependent variables or a character vector with variable names when data is defined.

    iv

    A data frame or vector with the independent variable or a character if data is defined.

    data

    A data frame.

    conditions

    A character vector of length two with the names of the two conditions. Defaults to the first two levels of the independent variable 'iv' if applicable.

    labels

    A character vector of length two with labels for the dependent variables.

    concise

    A more concise table with mean and SD in one column.

    nice_p

    If TRUE, p values are printed in a nice format.

    digits

    Number of digits for rounding mean and SD values

    var_equal

    If FALSE, a t-test for unequal variances is calculated.

    order

    Either "12" or "21" depicting whether group two is compared to group one or vice versa.

    type

    Either "df" for data frame or "html" for html table.

    caption

    Table caption is type = "html"

    bootstrap_options

    see kable_styling()

    full_width

    see kable_styling()

    Value

    A tibble or a kableExtra object

    Examples

    dv <- data.frame(
  a = c(rnorm(85, 50, 10), rnorm(200, 70, 20)),
  b = c(rnorm(85, 50, 10), rnorm(200, 55, 20)),
  iv = factor(c(rep("A", 85), rep("B", 200)))
)

t_test_table(
  c("a", "b"), "iv", data = dv, 
  labels = c("Motivation", "Achievement")
)
#> <table class=" lightable-classic" style='font-family: "Arial Narrow", "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;border-bottom: 0;'>
#> <caption>t-test table</caption>

#>    <th style="text-align:center;"> d </th>
#>    <th style="text-align:center;"> t </th>
#>    <th style="text-align:center;"> df </th>
#>    <th style="text-align:center;"> p </th>

#>   </tr>

#>    <td style="text-align:center;"> 276.1 </td>
#>    <td style="text-align:center;"> &lt;.001 </td>

#>    <td style="text-align:center;"> 56.5 (21.3) </td>
#>    <td style="text-align:center;"> -0.3 </td>
#>    <td style="text-align:center;"> -3.19 </td>
#>    <td style="text-align:center;"> 274.6 </td>
#>    <td style="text-align:center;"> &lt;.001 </td>
